Iconography in the Catholic Church.name: Satti
Iconography in the Catholic Church.reply: It is 100%. That does not mean it is fixable. The whole thing a fabricated glory among the status and the stained glass. Think of this : jesus converted water into wine. Never. Lie as clear as the sun. Convert the pure source of life into a stink sinister alcohol that derails minds. Jesus does not do that.

Transitioning from a 9-5 Job to Becoming.name: Terry Banks
Transitioning from a 9-5 Job to Becoming.reply: Good article, thanks for sharing. I have just one problem which is in the first paragraph, you wrote â€œbut it is a work in progress which I suspect will take a few years.â€ I think â€œExpectâ€ in place of â€œSuspectâ€ is a more suitable word to use, business is not classic gambling, though one has to be daring at times with his/her choices. â€œSuspectâ€ could be so distracting to some readers, because it doesnâ€™t signify certainty. It also doesnâ€™t reflect the enthusiastic nature of the writer.

Transitioning from a 9-5 Job to Becoming.name: Ameaka
Transitioning from a 9-5 Job to Becoming.reply: One of my pet peevesğŸ˜‚. My obsessive desire to always finish what I start like yesterday.

The Griot Who Refused To Sing The Mansaâ.name: Louise Foerster
The Griot Who Refused To Sing The Mansaâ.reply: Touched and proud of this woman who did what she thought and felt was right! Beautifully done!

The Blind Man of Marrakech.name: EnowFlorence
The Blind Man of Marrakech.reply: Very often God appears to us in so many ways but we don't notice Him either because we are carried away with our personal interest or because we discriminate. We therefore missed our blessings.

The Blind Man of Marrakech.name: MohManyang
The Blind Man of Marrakech.reply: @EnowFlorence that's so true, many of us miss our blessings without realising it

Marvel's Black Panther.name: Soob
Marvel's Black Panther.reply: I thought the film was visually stunning, and even better now learning about the specific aspects of African cultures it's based on - thank you! I saw it with a white British friend of mine and he seemed embarrassed to enjoy it, like he felt wrong about ogling the African-ness for entertainment or something. :-S One critique I'd make about the film - did stopping the shipment of weapons imply that all the Africans in the world are 'the bad guy'?! I'd like to think that even if the shipment got through, it wouldn't inevitably lead to all-out war, and something more nuanced would've happened. I'm not sure.

Marvel's Black Panther.name: MohManyang
Marvel's Black Panther.reply: @Soob I agree with you about the shipment of weapons. On its own, i don't think it would have led to all out war. If war ensued it would have been a contributing factor but not the sole cause

Victim Blaming.name: Lamour
Victim Blaming.reply: This is a must-read given the background and community we come from. The excuses men get away with, while women suffer in silence. Good write up Mo.

Victim Blaming.name: MohManyang
Victim Blaming.reply: @Lamour you're so right. We as a community must do better.

Keeping the Faith.name: Luth
Keeping the Faith.reply: Thank you for sharing Beyang. May God keep us on faith till the day we die, protect us from despair, and keep us ever hopeful of His Mercy.
